title: Colonial Era Words
description: Explore the language of early American colonists and their daily life (1600s-1700s)

questions.question: In colonial America, what was a 'commonplace book'?
options: A personal notebook for recording quotes and ideas

questions.question: What did colonists mean by 'the stocks'?
options: A wooden frame for public punishment

questions.question: In colonial times, what was a 'tanner'?
options: A person who turned animal hides into leather

questions.question: What was a 'hornbook' in colonial education?
options: A flat board with a lesson sheet protected by transparent horn

questions.question: In colonial America, what did 'bundling' refer to?
options: A courting practice where a couple shared a bed fully clothed
Wrapping a baby in swaddling clothes

questions.question: What was a 'cooper' in the colonial period?
In colonial language, what was a 'sampler'?
options: An embroidered cloth displaying needlework skills

questions.question: What did 'pillory' refer to in colonial America?
options: A wooden frame that trapped the head and hands for public punishment

questions.question: In the colonial era, what was a 'broadside'?
What was a 'dame school' in colonial times?
options: A basic school run by a woman in her home

questions.question: In colonial vocabulary, what did 'husbandry' mean?
options: The practice of farming and managing a household

questions.question: What was a 'chandler' in colonial America?
options: A maker or seller of candles and soap
